content: As noted previously, Swift beat us to the punch on launching a portable SIMD API. I'm not even md tbh. But also, Swift uses the term "pointwise" for their vector operations. As we need some jargon ("vertical" or "lanewise"), adopting consistency with them might be good.
imho elementwise or lanewise is better than pointwise -- simply because I've never heard pointwise used in a simd context before. i'm quite familiar with elementwise and lanewise.
vertical is somewhat worse than elementwise/lanewise because it is less descriptive
likewise imho we should probably use reduce_X instead of horizontal_X
Yeah, I have if anything else grown to dislike the "vertical" / "horizontal" terms. They aren't actually very descriptive and can be confusing.

Jubilee said:

I think for a while I was visualizing SIMD ops as being de facto horizontal when lanewise, which made it harder. ^^;
something that's like one letter would honestly be best
